content.question: The graph of the function <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 9, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> consists of four line segments, as shown above. Let <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, the integral from, 4 to x, of, g of t, d t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the value of <math alttext="f of 8" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> ?

topic.text: 6.7: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Definite Integrals
